intro: Pedicularis sunkosiana, commonly known as the Sikkim lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
